name: Aroma Suites

reviews.text: We had 7 nights at Aroma Suites and had a great time. From the moment Fanes picked us up at the airport we were made to feel very welcome. The hotel is in a great location, 3 minutes walk to the main bus stop, close to a supermarket, right at the start of the Caldera walk. Fanes recommended a few restaurants, the best ones being Naoussa in thira and katrina taverna in Ammoydi. Watch the sunset in Oia then go down to the delightful harbour and enjoy some great seafood. The beaches in santorini arent particularly good, we spent most of our time at Perissa which didnt have any rocks. Prices vary a lot on the island - €2 for a gyros was cheap i thought, through to €7 for a pint of beer! and i though London was expensive! Beware the 2 for 1 cocktail deals - they are a rip off, worst cocktails I have ever had. Nikolas was also worth a meal, quite cheap but tasty food, you will have to queue in peak times though. Only complaint about aroma suites was we though the bed wasnt particularly comfortable and 1 thin pillow each is not enough. The suites are cute and quaint, but not 5 star luxury by any means. You do get your own balcony with amazing views though, and the price compares favourably to other properties. Thanks Fanes for a great holiday!
reviews.title: Great location and views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Santorini to get married (on 4th July). For our first 7 nights in Santorini we stayed at the Tamarix Del Mar hotel in Kamari (see seperate review).
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Aroma Suites

reviews.text: We were picked up by Fanes from the Tamarix and imediately liked him. He is a genuinely nice guy, who clearly has a lot of passion about the hotel. Upon arrival, he showed us to our room, the honeymoon suite, with a jacuzzi. The room was beautiful.
reviews.title: Wonderful in Every Way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our wedding day, Fanes and his wife decorated the balcony and the hotel area which we thought was a really nice touch. Our wedding was out of this world and for anyone thinking of getting married in Santorini, we would highly recommend it. It has to be the most beautiful and romantic island in the world and we instantly fell in love with it and can not wait to go back.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing we would of liked with it being the honeymoon suite, was a private balcony. The balcony outside the honeymoon suite is shared with two other rooms to the left. They did have a table and two chairs outside each room, but it was a fairly small area and wasn't very private. Also, after reading another recent review, the view was amazing, but it is obscured by telegraph poles and wires e.t.c. but it was not too much of an inconvenience.
reviews.title: Experience Santorini at its best, with Fanes!

likes.disliked: — water pressure in the shower is minimal at times

reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about the Aroma Suites! From the moment we arrived until our departure, Fanes at the Aroma Suites treated us incredibly well. He went out of his way to make us feel welcome and our visit unforgettable. The property is breathtaking (you couldn't ask for a better view!) and the rooms are beautiful! Definitely look into this property if you are visiting Fira, Santorini - I just hope that Fanes makes room for me the next time that I visit! Thanks again Fanes!
reviews.title: Treated like princesses!!

reviews.text: What an amazing place to stay! The location is perfectly placed in the city Fira with a breath taking view of the Aegean Sea. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. Our host/owner was fabulous. He made sure that we were comfortable and had everything we needed during our entire stay. I could never ask for a better experience.
reviews.title: Amazing Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aroma suites is the best boutique hotel in Fira, Santorini. Fanes, the owner welcomed us with open arms. The best thing is he upgraded us to the honeymoon suite. Wow! The room was really huge and the view was amazing. No need to go to the caldera view deck, you have your own view on the caldera 24 hours a day. Aroma suite is open all year round unlike other hotels which opens only on march-october. I can't say anything bad about this hotel or Fanes. He really did a good job on welcoming us and teaching us where to go or where to eat. After picking us at the airport, Fanes showed us where is the best place to eat (mmmmm soulvaki), the bus terminal ( which is 2 minute walk from the room), places to see and other things. We stayed there for 2 nights for our honeymoon. 1 night in the double cave room and the next night on the honeymoon suite. Aroma suites is an excellent hotel to end you vacation. Thanks a lot Fanes! The best hotel in town. By the way, we stayed here from Jan 17-19, 2008.
reviews.title: The Best hotel in Fira, santorini

Great Location, & Fun!
reviews.text: We are glad to have found Aroma Suites on Trip Advisor.

This array of nicely-equipped, white-and-blue-washed hillside "caves" vary from cozy to spacious. All are very clean (cleaned daily) and have modern amenities: air conditioning; mini-fridge; valuables safe; plentiful and fun lighting; very secure and modern doors and windows; attractive and intact tile floors; good if compact bathroom (shower, toilet, sink); stereo CD player; phone; TV; comfortable queen bed; fresh linens daily. Storage space is limited but not a problem unless you are disabled.
reviews.title: beautiful room, amazing view
Great place
reviews.text: Each unit has its own outdoor terrace with wonderful views of Thira (nearby), Oia in the distance, the caldera/bay, and the other islands formed by the eruption of what was once a very sizable volcano. The terraces and units are stepped up the hillside to ensure that each unit has its own views. Each terrace has a table, at least two chairs, and a good-sized sun umbrella. Some have small trees or other plants. Fantastic spots for meals, snacks, and photography -- or just for watching Santorini's spectacular sunsets, ever-changing blue skies and cloud formations, and the comings and goings of ferries, cruise ships, fishing boats -- and burros! -- below.

The only downside to the many terraced cave apartments and rooms in Thira and Oia is that the myriad power poles and utility wires really intrude on the otherwise heavenly views. When booking any facility on Santorini, ask your host to specify which units have the least-impacted views re such wires and poles. We actually moved from innkeeper Fanes' and his wife's best suite to a slightly smallish unit just to get a clearer view -- but we lost a shade tree and a hot tub in the process, so you might want to consider your priorities well. If you prefer the Honeymoon Suite's fun Moorish bed, hot tub and sitting area, it's really only a few steps to a clear photo-taking spot.
reviews.title: Could not be better

reviews.text: Fanes or his wife listen for sounds of your arising in the morning; the moment they hear your door open, they rush to you to ask if you are ready for some Greek coffee or tea. Fanes' wife [whose name, sadly, we never learned] tends to stay in the background, but is very attentive and responsive to household needs. Fanes is a gracious host, eager to please and to assist with your needs.
reviews.title: Fantastic Service, Treated like family

description: Beautiful Aroma Suites, on the tip of the Santorini Caldera opposite the Volcano - a charming Cycladic settlement ... graceful, serene, a quiet haven for relaxation on the magnificent island of Santorini. Six rooms & apartments & the Honeymoon Suite, each room named after a herb or spice, and each decorated in vibrant joyful colours ... " Lemongrass, spearmint, lavender, mint & basil born to this island " ... Aroma Suites Hotel in Santorini is without a doubt an excellent choice.
